meanings.definition: To defeat in a debate by presenting arguments more effectively.
meanings.sent1: She outdebated her opponent with clear and logical points.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys outdebating others on various topics.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be outdebating the dog on who gets the sunny spot by the window.
meanings.sent4: Her wit and intelligence always outdebate any opposing views.
meanings.sent5: The student outdebating the teacher was a sight to behold.

meanings.sent2: The experienced debater was known for outdebating all challengers.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was outdebating the birds on the best route to the feeder.
meanings.sent4: His passion for the topic allowed him to outdebate even the most skilled opponents.
meanings.sent5: Outdebating his own record, he won the championship trophy.
